newsitem.title: UK: Bradford wool market eases, further falls likely.
newsitem.headline: Bradford wool market eases, further falls likely.

text.p: Topmakers quotations slipped as much as five pence per kilo with further falls thought to be likely.
Sterling's strength was said to be hampering the UK wool market as this makes overseas wool cheaper, with higher UK interest rates adding fuel to this particular fire.
However, at present deliveries are often said to be going out well and machinery was keeping active, brokers said.
